meanings.definition: Adhering strictly to a particular style or set of principles.
meanings.sent1: She has a puristic approach to interior design, always sticking to minimalistic styles.
meanings.sent2: The artist's puristic paintings only use black and white colors.
meanings.sent3: It's almost comical how puristic he is about organizing his bookshelf by color.
meanings.sent4: Her puristic dedication to yoga is like a finely tuned instrument, never wavering.
meanings.sent5: The puristic beauty of the sunset left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a desire to maintain traditional or pure forms.
meanings.sent1: The puristic architecture of the building reflected the city's history.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the puristic design of vintage cars over modern ones.
meanings.sent3: His puristic insistence on handwritten letters in the digital age is endearing.
meanings.sent4: The puristic essence of the melody transported listeners to another era.
meanings.sent5: The puristic craftsmanship of the handmade pottery was evident in every detail.
